thread.title: Liverpool held by Southampton as Jurgen Klopp waits for first win
thread.title_full: Liverpool held by Southampton as Jurgen Klopp waits for first win

title: Liverpool held by Southampton as Jurgen Klopp waits for first win
text:
Date: 25-10-2015 Time: 06:10:56:pm Jurgen Klopp 
Jurgen Klopp was denied his first win as Liverpool manager as Sadio Mane grabbed a late equaliser for Southampton in a 1-1 draw at Anfield. 
Mane finished from less than a yard out with five minutes left, cancelling out a majestic Christian Benteke header that appeared to put Liverpool on course for three points. 
Liverpool have drawn all three games under Klopp, and a share of the points was a fair result after a game in which both sides showed plenty of attacking intent but little composure in front of goal. 
Benteke, on as a half-time substitute for Divock Origi, broke the deadlock with a powerful header from James Milner's cross. 
But Southampton drew level when Gaston Ramirez headed across goal and Mane got the final touch. Mane was sent off in stoppage time for a second bookable offence but there was no time for Liverpool to capitalise on their numerical advantage. SHARE THIS STORY
